name: Mengnan Du
content: Mengnan DuSearchMengnan DuAssistant ProfessorNew Jersey Institute of TechnologyBiographyHe is an assistant professor in the Department of Data Science, New Jersey Institute of Technology (NJIT), with a joint appointment in the Department of Computer Science. Before that, he earned the Ph.D. in Computer Science from Texas A&M University, under the supervision of Dr. Xia Hu. He has previously worked with leading tech companies including Microsoft Research, Adobe Research, Intel, and Baidu Research. Currently, he lead the Trustworthy Machine Learning Research Lab (TMLR lab). He serves as a Senior Area Chair for EMNLP, and as an Area Chair for NeurIPS, ICML, ICLR, ACL, and AISTATS. He also serves as Action Editor for TMLR and Associate Editor for Applied AI Letters.His research interests lie within the domain of trustworthy machine learning, with a particular emphasis on the intersection of trustworthy machine learning with large language models (LLMs), particularly explainability of LLMs. His recent efforts in trustworthy LLMs can be found here. He is also increasingly interested in exploring the application of LLMs to real-world domains such as law, finance, and bioinformatics. The ultimate goal of his research is to improve the usefulness and trustworthiness of LLMs in practical and impactful applications.I am actively seeking motivated PhD students and interns. If you are interested in working with me, please feel free to email me.
